docs.snippet: Pyotr Pavlensky was taken to a hospital notorious for giving insanity diagnoses to political dissidents in the Soviet period, raising worries about a revival of politicized psychiatry....
docs.lead_paragraph: Pyotr Pavlensky was taken to a hospital notorious for giving insanity diagnoses to political dissidents in the Soviet period, raising worries about a revival of politicized psychiatry.
docs.abstract: Russian authorities send performance artist Pyotr Pavlensky to Serbsky State Scientific Center for Social and Forensic Psychiatry, institute with history of diagnosing political dissidents as insane; detained artist's works have included nailing his scrotum to Red Square.

headline.main: Russian Dissident Artist Is Said to Be Sent for Psychiatric Evaluation

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Serbsky State Scientific Center for Social and Forensic Psychiatry (Russia)

docs.snippet: Russian landowners trying to increase domestic agriculture production are using trainers from the United States to teach workers about riding horses and herding cattle....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russian landowners trying to increase domestic agriculture production are using trainers from the United States to teach workers about riding horses and herding cattle.
docs.abstract: Valuets Journal; central Russian ranches attempting to revive country's post-Soviet agriculture industry employ American cowboys as trainers; novice cowboys learn to endure long days of arduous work without resorting to vodka; Russia's sinking economy, weakened by Western sanctions, has made food self-sufficiency national priority.

headline.main: Russians Learn the Ways of the Cowboy From American Ranch Hands

docs.snippet: A spokesman for the main opposition bloc said it wanted an assurance from Secretary General Ban Ki-moon that the Syrian government would lift its sieges of rebel-held towns....
docs.lead_paragraph: A spokesman for the main opposition bloc said it wanted an assurance from Secretary General Ban Ki-moon that the Syrian government would lift its sieges of rebel-held towns.
docs.abstract: Opposition parties in Syrian conflict say they will not attend Geneva peace talks unless United Nations Sec Gen Ban K-moon guarantees Syrian government will lift sieges on rebel-held towns; United States and Saudi Arabia-backed bloc is under intense pressure as Russian military assistance increasingly bolsters Pres Bashar al-Assad's regime.

headline.main: Syrian Opposition Bloc Still Won’t Commit to Joining Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Syrian Opposition Bloc Still Won’t Commit to Joining Peace Talks
